misconceptions.inferred_category_name: Correct Implementation of Array Right Shift
misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student employed the correct algorithmic approach for a single-step right circular shift: 1) Save the last element, 2) Shift all elements from index n-1 down to 1 (inclusive) by copying the element from the position to the left (i-1), and 3) Place the saved last element into index 0.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: There is no conceptual gap regarding the array shifting mechanism in this specific code snippet. The student correctly understands array indexing, temporary variable usage for preserving data during overwrites, and loop boundaries necessary for an in-place modification.
misconceptions.error_manifestation: Logically correct code, produces the expected output for the sample case.
